conclusion: Determine the current flowing through the circuit to find the power dissipated in lamp L2.
Lamp L1 has a specification of 3V, 3W.
Calculate resistance R1 of lamp L1 using P = V^2/R.
Current I1 through lamp L1 is 1 A.
Emf generated by the moving conductor is equal to the voltage across L1, which is 3V.
Calculate velocity v of the conductor using emf = B * l * v.
Total resistance R_total of the circuit is the sum of the resistance of the conductor and lamp L1.
Current I in the entire circuit is the same as the current through lamp L1, which is 1 A.
Voltage across lamp L2 is the remaining voltage after accounting for the voltage drop across the conductor and lamp L1.
Voltage across lamp L2 is 0 V.
Re-evaluate the power dissipated in lamp L2.
Power P2 dissipated in lamp L2 is given by P2 = I^2 * R2.
Power rating of lamp L2 is 6W.
Power dissipated in lamp L2 is 6 W.
